page.title: 09UPTON HOUSE AND COUNTRY PARK
page.content: { The house was built around{1818. }The architecture is in the Italian style and is unusual in that it has curved colonnaded screens on either side of the main house. The house was built by the{Spurvier}family, wealthy merchants and bankers. The family fortune was amassed from successful trading in Newfoundland Cod. The house passed through the hands of several families, including the {Doughties}and finally the{Llewellins. Mr W. Llewellin was the High Sherriff of Dorset in 1919. His son John became an MP in 1929 and became president of the Board of Trade. He was made Baron Llewellin of Upton in 1945. Lord Llewellin was Governor General of Rhodesia from 1953-1957. The house and grounds were given to Poole in{1957.
